item.title: Canyons ‘Gameplay’ teaser trailer – co-op PvE third-person shooter for PS5, PC
item.content:encoded:
About

Canyons is a cooperative player-versus-environment game set in a procedurally generated post-apocalyptic world where survival is only possible in the canyons. Play solo or gather a team of up to four players. Arm yourselves to the teeth, grab supplies, and set out to conquer the canyons on massive Crawlers.

Crawlers

The vast waters disappeared hundreds of years ago, but the spirit of the pioneer ancestors and their inventions remain timeless. Become the captain of a Crawler—a colossal machine from the past, essential for traversing the canyons.

Modify, upgrade, and develop your steel companion! Unless, of course, you find a better friend—here, sentimentality has no place.

Expeditions

Welcome to a world teeming with dangers, endless storms, scorching sun, fearsome creatures, and humans steeped in cruelty. You’re very welcome here, especially if you’re tasty. Gather loyal friends, load ammo onto your rusty Crawler, and embark on expeditions to conquer, save, build, or destroy these damned canyons. Will you risk everything for legendary rewards, or will you wisely return home when things get tough? The choice is yours. There are no right decisions or proven paths here, but there is a complex procedural generation system with hand-crafted details and unique events that will let you feel the crunch of sand under your scurvy-ridden teeth over and over again.

Haven

No matter how brave a warrior you are, one day you’ll have to return home. Establish your settlement in the canyon caves, equip it with everything survivors need, and they will gladly settle there. Build a shipyard for Crawler construction, garages for repair and tuning, an armory, or a fancy cafeteria with zombie burgers. Create infrastructure for traders, medics, workers, and more! And of course, ensure the protection of your home haven, as there will always be those who covet what you have.

Captain

Shooting is good, but shooting well is even better, and to achieve this, you must develop your captain. Besides improving basic stats, you can master dozens of professions, each enhancing your character in some aspect of the game.

While shooting bottles and lifting weights, don’t forget about morality. The canyons are a harsh place, often forcing difficult choices. How will you treat a survivor dying of thirst? Give them precious water, take them to your harbor, rob them, leave them to the monsters, or even eat them yourself? The decision is yours! But remember, everything has consequences.

Inhabitants

No matter how crazy an idea seems, it will always gather a group of followers. The canyons are no exception. The crowd here is peculiar. Lawmen, Marauders, the Diesel Cult, and many others await you on their lands. Or don’t—they might react uniquely to your actions and morality score. Find common ground with them, and they will aid you. For example, the Lawmen can provide the best equipment, the Diesel Cult can grant access to the finest transport and Crawler modules, and the Sun Fanatics will simply blow your head off—they are hated by everyone, and the feeling is mutual.

Of course, humans are not the only inhabitants of these lands. In the canyons, you will encounter Shrivelled, Creepers, Savages, and many other creatures that mothers use to scare misbehaving children.

item.title: Rewilders: The Lost Spring ‘Grasslands’ private playtest set for November 12 to 19
item.content:encoded:
• PC

New video showcases gameplay mechanics, story, and characters.

Herobeat Studios has will host a the “Grasslands” private playtest for open-world roguelite action game Rewilders: The Lost Spring from November 12 to 19, the developer announced. Sign-ups are available now via the game’s Steam page.

The developer also released a new video featuring the latest look at gameplay, traversal, and dangers in the open world, plus a few hints at the story and characters.

Get the latest details below.

About

In their latest video, the developers elaborate on the core gameplay of their upcoming open-world roguelite, featuring Metroidvania and creature-collecting elements. Many roguelite, roguelike, and Soulsborne players will be familiar with a home base as the anchor point, where players can rest, engage with rescued creatures, and rework their approach when venturing out into the world. Rewilders: The Lost Spring features a floating airship that presents several facets to play with, from planting seeds that sprout buffs, crafting consumables and weapons, to evolving you and your companions, known as Hantu. Traversal methods, such as the Hookshot and wall run, are available and can be earned through boss fights.

Videos, as lovely as they are, only convey so much when it comes to games. From November 12 to 17, a select number of playtesters will be invited to try Rewilders: The Lost Spring‘s Grasslands Playtest. Sign-ups are open now on Steam, and once approved, playtesters will be able to access future playtests starting with the Grasslands Playtest. More details will be shared on Steam and Discord, so we invite all potential players and playtesters to join as the game develops towards Early Access.

Key Features

  • An open-world roguelite experience where curiosity and discovery go hand in hand, finding items, secrets, and paths to new challenges.
  • Growth and rewards to be gained from fighting back against the corruption of Abi’s home across five unique biomes with their own bosses.
  • Multiple combinations and approaches to play with while engaging in combat, utilizing several kinds of Hântu, abilities, levels, and buffs (permanent or temporary).
  • A heart-warming story about family, friendship, resilience, and kindness.
  • Moving music, scenes from renowned artist Julie Elven, and the makers of Endling: Extinction is Forever.

The Story of Rewilders: The Lost Spring

Players will embody Abi, a survivor returning to the poisoned surface of the world to rescue her lost family and restore the wild. While exploring corrupted biomes—unlocking Hantu, finding lore, secrets, and enemies born from a failed society—she will come across her family and help restore them just as she will her environments, with the help of a mysterious being called Rif. The team was heavily inspired by the works of Hayao Miyazaki and Studio Ghibli films, which convey messages of ecological destruction, empowerment, and family, while developing Rewilders: The Lost Spring. Utilizing creative audio-visual presentations and gameplay to tell evocative stories is a key component of Herobeat’s development philosophy.

Rewilders: The Lost Spring is due out in Early Access for PC via Steam in 2026, followed by PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, an dSwitch at a later date.
